UnnecessaryBooleanAssertion.description:
Description

A JUnit test assertion with a boolean literal is unnecessary since it always will evaluate to the same thing.
Consider using flow control (in case ofassertTrue(false)or similar) or simply removing
statements likeassertTrue(true)andassertFalse(false). If you just want a test to halt after finding
an error, use thefail()method and provide an indication message of why it did.
